alert.note: Alert for Chatham; Harnett; Lee (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 27 at 4:48PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...An area strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Harnett, eastern Lee, southwestern Wake and southeastern Chatham Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 446 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorms producing heavy rainfall 7 miles east of Sanford, moving northeast at 25 mph. Training thunderstorms may produce localized flooding from Lemon Springs and Pineview to southern Wake County. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. Heavy rainfall leading to localized flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cary, Fuquay-Varina, Angier, Apex, Holly Springs, Broadway, Lemon Springs, New Hill, Raven Rock State Park and Olivia. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
